```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,347 @@
- 
+ # Flutter Project Starter
+ 
+ A Mason brick for scaffolding production-ready Flutter projects with flavors, Firebase, Riverpod, and modern tooling.
+ 
+ ## Overview
+ 
+ This repository contains a [Mason](https://github.com/felangel/mason) brick that generates a complete Flutter project structure with:
+ 
+ - **Multi-environment Flavors**: Development, Staging, and Production
+ - **State Management**: Riverpod 3.0.3 with code generation
+ - **Routing**: GoRouter 17.0.0 with type-safe routes
+ - **Local Database**: Sembast with encryption support
+ - **HTTP Client**: Dio with Alice debugging inspector
+ - **Firebase**: Core, Messaging, and FlutterFire CLI integration
+ - **Responsive Design**: Flutter ScreenUtil
+ - **Localization**: English and Indonesian (extensible)
+ - **Form Handling**: Flutter Form Builder with validators
+ - **Custom Icons &amp; Splash**: Automated generation via Flutter Launcher Icons and Native Splash
+ 
+ ## Prerequisites
+ 
+ Before using this brick, ensure you have:
+ 
+ 1. **Flutter SDK** (&gt;= 3.38.0)
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    flutter --version
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Mason CLI**
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    dart pub global activate mason_cli
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 3. **FlutterFire CLI** (for Firebase configuration)
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    dart pub global activate flutterfire_cli
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 4. **Firebase CLI** (logged in with your account)
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    npm install -g firebase-tools
+    firebase login
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Installation
+ 
+ ### Option 1: Local Installation (Recommended for Development)
+ 
+ Clone this repository and add the brick locally:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Clone the repository
+ git clone &lt;repository-url&gt;
+ cd project-starter
+ 
+ # Get Mason dependencies
+ mason get
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Option 2: Git Installation
+ 
+ Add directly from Git in your global mason configuration:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ mason add starter --git-url &lt;repository-url&gt; --git-path src
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Usage
+ 
+ ### Generate a New Project
+ 
+ From the repository root (or anywhere if installed globally):
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ mason make starter
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Interactive Prompts
+ 
+ The generator will ask for the following information:
+ 
+ | Prompt | Description | Default |
+ |--------|-------------|---------|
+ | &#96;project_name&#96; | Project name in snake_case (used in pubspec.yaml) | &#96;my_app&#96; |
+ | &#96;app_name&#96; | Display name shown on device | &#96;My App&#96; |
+ | &#96;app_id&#96; | Bundle/application ID (e.g., &#96;com.company.myapp&#96;) | &#96;com.example.myapp&#96; |
+ | &#96;custom_icon&#96; | Whether to use a custom app icon | &#96;false&#96; |
+ | &#96;use_splash&#96; | Implement native splash screen | &#96;true&#96; |
+ | &#96;firebase_project_id&#96; | Your Firebase project ID | (required) |
+ 
+ If you select custom options:
+ - **Custom Icon**: You'll be prompted for the path to your icon file (1024x1024 PNG recommended)
+ - **Splash Screen**: You'll be prompted for the path to your splash image
+ 
+ ### Non-Interactive Mode
+ 
+ You can also pass variables directly:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ mason make starter \
+   --project_name awesome_app \
+   --app_name "Awesome App" \
+   --app_id com.mycompany.awesomeapp \
+   --custom_icon false \
+   --use_splash true
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Generated Project Structure
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ your_project_name/
+ ├── android/
+ │   └── app/src/
+ │       ├── dev/              # Dev flavor config
+ │       ├── stg/              # Staging flavor config
+ │       ├── prod/             # Production flavor config
+ │       └── main/
+ │           └── kotlin/&lt;package&gt;/ # Generated from app_id
+ │
+ ├── ios/
+ │   ├── flavors/
+ │   │   ├── dev/              # GoogleService-Info.plist (dev)
+ │   │   ├── stg/              # GoogleService-Info.plist (stg)
+ │   │   └── prod/             # GoogleService-Info.plist (prod)
+ │   └── Runner/
+ │
+ ├── lib/
+ │   ├── firebase_options/     # Environment-specific Firebase options
+ │   │   ├── firebase_options_dev.dart
+ │   │   ├── firebase_options_stg.dart
+ │   │   └── firebase_options_prod.dart
+ │   ├── src/
+ │   │   ├── common_widget/    # Reusable UI components
+ │   │   ├── constant/         # App constants and error messages
+ │   │   ├── core/             # Core mixins and utilities
+ │   │   ├── feature/          # Feature modules (authentication, home, etc.)
+ │   │   ├── localization/     # L10n configuration and ARB files
+ │   │   ├── routing/          # GoRouter configuration
+ │   │   ├── service/          # Firebase and notification services
+ │   │   ├── theme/            # App theming
+ │   │   └── utils/            # Utilities and data source config
+ │   │
+ │   ├── flavor.dart           # Flavor enum and configuration
+ │   ├── initializer.dart      # App initialization logic
+ │   ├── main_dev.dart         # Development entry point
+ │   ├── main_stg.dart         # Staging entry point
+ │   └── main_prod.dart        # Production entry point
+ │
+ ├── assets/
+ │   ├── android/              # Android-specific icons
+ │   ├── common/               # Shared assets (icons, splash)
+ │   └── icons/                # SVG icons
+ │
+ ├── flutterfire-config.sh     # Firebase config script (pre-configured)
+ ├── pubspec.yaml
+ └── l10n.yaml
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Post-Generation Steps
+ 
+ The brick automatically handles most setup, but you may need to:
+ 
+ ### 1. Verify Firebase Configuration
+ 
+ The generator runs &#96;flutterfire config&#96; for all three flavors automatically. If it fails (e.g., Firebase project not found), run manually:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd your_project_name
+ 
+ # Configure each flavor
+ ./flutterfire-config.sh dev
+ ./flutterfire-config.sh stg
+ ./flutterfire-config.sh prod
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 2. Install Dependencies
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ flutter pub get
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 3. Generate Code (Riverpod, GoRouter, etc.)
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ dart run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 4. Run the App
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Development flavor
+ flutter run --flavor dev -t lib/main_dev.dart
+ 
+ # Staging flavor
+ flutter run --flavor stg -t lib/main_stg.dart
+ 
+ # Production flavor
+ flutter run --flavor prod -t lib/main_prod.dart
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Custom Assets
+ 
+ ### App Icon
+ 
+ To use a custom app icon after generation:
+ 
+ 1. Replace files in &#96;assets/common/&#96; and &#96;assets/android/&#96;
+ 2. Run:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    flutter pub run flutter_launcher_icons
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Recommended icon specifications:
+ - **iOS**: 1024x1024 PNG (no transparency for App Store)
+ - **Android Foreground**: 1024x1024 PNG with safe zone considerations
+ - **Android Background**: 1024x1024 PNG or solid color
+ 
+ ### Splash Screen
+ 
+ If you enabled splash screen and want to customize later:
+ 
+ 1. Replace &#96;assets/common/app-splash.png&#96;
+ 2. Update colors in &#96;pubspec.yaml&#96; under &#96;flutter_native_splash:&#96;
+ 3. Run:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    flutter pub run flutter_native_splash:create
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Flavor Configuration
+ 
+ Each flavor has separate configurations for:
+ 
+ | Aspect | Dev | Staging | Prod |
+ |--------|-----|---------|------|
+ | App Name | &#96;{app_name} [DEV]&#96; | &#96;{app_name} [STG]&#96; | &#96;{app_name}&#96; |
+ | Bundle ID | &#96;{app_id}.dev&#96; | &#96;{app_id}.stg&#96; | &#96;{app_id}&#96; |
+ | Firebase | Separate project/config | Separate project/config | Separate project/config |
+ 
+ ## Included Packages
+ 
+ ### Core Dependencies
+ 
+ | Package | Version | Purpose |
+ |---------|---------|---------|
+ | &#96;flutter_riverpod&#96; | 3.0.3 | State management |
+ | &#96;go_router&#96; | 17.0.0 | Declarative routing |
+ | &#96;dio&#96; | 5.9.0 | HTTP client |
+ | &#96;sembast&#96; | 3.8.5 | Local NoSQL database |
+ | &#96;firebase_core&#96; | 4.2.1 | Firebase initialization |
+ | &#96;firebase_messaging&#96; | 16.0.4 | Push notifications |
+ | &#96;flutter_screenutil&#96; | 5.9.3 | Responsive design |
+ | &#96;google_fonts&#96; | 6.3.2 | Typography |
+ 
+ ### Dev Dependencies
+ 
+ | Package | Version | Purpose |
+ |---------|---------|---------|
+ | &#96;build_runner&#96; | 2.10.2 | Code generation |
+ | &#96;riverpod_generator&#96; | 3.0.3 | Riverpod code gen |
+ | &#96;flutter_flavorizr&#96; | 2.4.1 | Flavor management |
+ | &#96;alice_dio&#96; | 1.0.7 | HTTP debugging |
+ 
+ ## Development
+ 
+ ### Project Structure
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ project-starter/
+ ├── src/
+ │   ├── __brick__/            # Template files (with Mustache variables)
+ │   │   └── {{project_name}}/
+ │   ├── hooks/
+ │   │   ├── pre_gen.dart      # Runs before generation (prompts)
+ │   │   ├── post_gen.dart     # Runs after generation (setup)
+ │   │   └── helper.dart       # Hook utilities
+ │   ├── brick.yaml            # Brick configuration
+ │   └── README.md             # Brick-specific readme
+ ├── mason.yaml                # Local brick registry
+ └── README.md                 # This file
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Modifying the Brick
+ 
+ 1. Edit template files in &#96;src/__brick__/{{project_name}}/&#96;
+ 2. Update variables in &#96;src/brick.yaml&#96;
+ 3. Modify hooks in &#96;src/hooks/&#96; for pre/post generation logic
+ 4. Test changes:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    mason make starter --output-dir ./test_output
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Template Syntax
+ 
+ This brick uses [Mustache](https://mustache.github.io/) templating:
+ 
+ - &#96;{{variable}}&#96; - Variable substitution
+ - &#96;{{#condition}}...{{/condition}}&#96; - Conditional block (true)
+ - &#96;{{^condition}}...{{/condition}}&#96; - Inverted block (false)
+ - &#96;{{#list}}...{{/list}}&#96; - Iteration
+ 
+ ## Troubleshooting
+ 
+ ### Firebase Configuration Fails
+ 
+ Ensure you're logged into Firebase CLI and the project ID is correct:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ firebase projects:list
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Android Build Fails with Package Not Found
+ 
+ The Kotlin directory structure should match your &#96;app_id&#96;. The brick creates this automatically, but verify:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ ls android/app/src/main/kotlin/
+ # Should show: com/yourcompany/yourapp/MainActivity.kt
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### iOS Build Fails
+ 
+ Ensure CocoaPods is up to date:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd ios &amp;&amp; pod install --repo-update
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Code Generation Issues
+ 
+ Clear build cache and regenerate:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ dart run build_runner clean
+ dart run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Resources
+ 
+ - [Mason Documentation](https://docs.brickhub.dev)
+ - [FlutterFire Documentation](https://firebase.flutter.dev)
+ - [Riverpod Documentation](https://riverpod.dev)
+ - [GoRouter Documentation](https://pub.dev/packages/go_router)
+ 
+ ## License
+ 
+ This project is open source. See the LICENSE file for details.
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -28,28 +30,70 @@
  ### Variables
  
- | Variable | Description | Default |
- |----------|-------------|---------|
- | &#96;project_name&#96; | Project name (snake_case, used in pubspec.yaml) | &#96;my_app&#96; |
- | &#96;app_name&#96; | Display name shown on device | &#96;My App&#96; |
- | &#96;app_id&#96; | Bundle/application ID (e.g., com.example.myapp) | &#96;com.example.myapp&#96; |
+ | Variable | Type | Description | Default |
+ |----------|------|-------------|---------|
+ | &#96;project_name&#96; | string | Project name (snake_case, used in pubspec.yaml) | &#96;my_app&#96; |
+ | &#96;app_name&#96; | string | Display name shown on device | &#96;My App&#96; |
+ | &#96;app_id&#96; | string | Bundle/application ID (e.g., com.example.myapp) | &#96;com.example.myapp&#96; |
+ | &#96;custom_icon&#96; | boolean | Whether to use a custom app icon | &#96;false&#96; |
+ | &#96;use_splash&#96; | boolean | Implement native splash screen | &#96;true&#96; |
+ 
+ ### Additional Prompts
+ 
+ During generation, you'll also be asked for:
+ 
+ - **Firebase Project ID**: Required for FlutterFire configuration
+ - **Custom Icon Path**: Path to your icon file (if &#96;custom_icon&#96; is true)
+ - **Splash Image Path**: Path to your splash image (if &#96;use_splash&#96; is true)
+ 
+ ## What Happens During Generation
+ 
+ ### Pre-Generation (pre_gen.dart)
+ 
+ 1. Prompts for Firebase project ID
+ 2. If &#96;custom_icon&#96; is true, prompts for icon file path
+ 3. If &#96;use_splash&#96; is true, prompts for splash image path
+ 
+ ### Post-Generation (post_gen.dart)
+ 
+ 1. Creates Kotlin package directory structure from &#96;app_id&#96;
+ 2. Runs &#96;flutterfire config&#96; for all three flavors (dev, stg, prod)
+ 3. If custom icon provided:
+    - Copies to appropriate asset locations
+    - Runs &#96;flutter_launcher_icons&#96; to generate all sizes
+ 4. If splash provided:
+    - Copies splash image to assets
+    - Runs &#96;flutter_native_splash:create&#96;
  
  ## Post-Generation Steps
  
- After generating the project:
+ Most setup is automated, but you may need to:
  
- 1. **Rename Android Kotlin directory**: Inside your generated project, move &#96;android/app/src/main/kotlin/id/logique/trial/&#96; to match your &#96;app_id&#96; structure (e.g., &#96;com/example/myapp/&#96;)
- 
- 2. **Configure Firebase**:
-    - Update &#96;YOUR_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID&#96; in &#96;flutterfire-config.sh&#96;
-    - Run &#96;./flutterfire-config.sh dev&#96; (and stg, prod)
- 
- 3. **Get dependencies**: &#96;flutter pub get&#96;
+ 1. **Verify Firebase Configuration** (if auto-config failed):
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    ./flutterfire-config.sh dev
+    ./flutterfire-config.sh stg
+    ./flutterfire-config.sh prod
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 2. **Get dependencies**:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    flutter pub get
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
  
- 4. **Generate code**: &#96;flutter pub run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs&#96;
+ 3. **Generate code**:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    dart run build_runner build --delete-conflicting-outputs
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ 4. **Run the app**:
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+    flutter run --flavor dev -t lib/main_dev.dart
+    &#96;&#96;&#96;
  
  ## Resources
  
  - [Official Mason Documentation][2]
  - [Code generation with Mason Blog][3]
+ - [FlutterFire Documentation](https://firebase.flutter.dev)
  
  [1]: https://github.com/felangel/mason
```

---

Done! I've created comprehensive documentation for your repository:

## Created Files

### `/README.md` (Root)

The main repository documentation covering:

- **Overview**: What this brick generates and key features
- **Prerequisites**: Required tools (Flutter, Mason CLI, FlutterFire CLI, Firebase CLI)
- **Installation**: Local and Git installation options
- **Usage**: Interactive and non-interactive generation modes
- **Generated Project Structure**: Full directory tree explanation
- **Post-Generation Steps**: Firebase verification, dependency installation, code generation, running the app
- **Custom Assets**: How to customize icons and splash screens after generation
- **Flavor Configuration**: Table showing dev/stg/prod differences
- **Included Packages**: Complete package list with versions and purposes
- **Development**: How to modify the brick template
- **Troubleshooting**: Common issues and solutions

### `/src/README.md` (Brick-specific)

Updated the existing brick README with:

- Complete variable table including `custom_icon` and `use_splash`
- Explanation of what hooks do during generation
- Clearer post-generation steps
- Links to relevant documentation

Both READMEs are consistent and complement each other - the root README is for repository users, while the src README is the brick-specific documentation that follows Mason conventions.

---
